intro: Verbesina minuticeps, commonly known as the small-headed beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, sticky hairs. Its small yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters, and the leaves are narrow with a slightly serrated edge. Verbesina minuticeps is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and woodland edges.
